As the Philippines continues to celebrate its golden boy, let us remember that the journey to the top is rarely a solitary one. Behind every champion like Yulo stands a community of supporters, mentors, and believers. Let us be that community for all aspiring athletes, nurturing the dreams that will one day bring pride and honor to our country. Carlos Yulo has etched his name in Olympic history, and his journey is a testament to the enduring spirit of the Filipino. With hard work and determination, the sky is the limit. The future of Philippine sports is bright, and it begins with each of us believing, investing, and cheering for those who dare to dream.

In my eyes, Rinconada deserves to be honored as a language, not merely as a dialect. Among the at least thirteen Bikol languages, Rinconada stands out for its complexity and depth. To truly preserve and celebrate Rinconada, we need concerted efforts to formalize it‚Äîfor instance, developing comprehensive dictionaries and integrating the language into academic and professional settings. As a native speaker of Rinconada, I also believe it‚Äôs time for Buwan ng Wikang Pambansa to evolve. Let us embrace "Buwan ng mga Wikang Filipino," a celebration that acknowledges not only Filipino but also all the languages that enrich our nation's cultural heritage.
